abstract: A revolt against the company's remuneration report, which included a $6.8 million compensation package for Robert Dudley, did not succeed in overturning it.
snippet: A revolt against the company's remuneration report, which included a $6.8 million compensation package for Robert Dudley, did not succeed in overturning it.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The oil giant BP fended off a revolt by a minority of its shareholders Thursday over the award of a salary, bonus and stock package worth around $6.8 million to its chief executive, Robert W. Dudley.

headline.main: BP Shareholders Approve Pay for New Chief
headline.print_headline: BP Shareholders Approve Pay for New Chief
